info.name: XML for websites: the deep dive
info.summary: In which I take a look at the carcasses left behind by the sheer enthusiasm of early and mid 2000s WWW.

content.p: You may have been introduced to XML as a sort of sister to HTML, being both applications of the "standard generalized markup language" (SGML) formalized back in the 80s. The difference is that you could use XML to mark up literally anything.
